solution_line_template: The solid wall is {wall_height} ft. * {wall_width} ft. = <<{wall_height}*{wall_width}={solid_wall_area}>>{solid_wall_area} sq. ft.
The doorway is {doorway_width} ft. * {doorway_height} ft. = <<{doorway_width}*{doorway_height}={doorway_area}>>{doorway_area} sq. ft.
The window is {window_width} ft. * {window_height} ft. = <<{window_width}*{window_height}={window_area}>>{window_area} sq. ft.
The closet door is {closet_door_width} ft. * {closet_door_height} ft. = <<{closet_door_width}*{closet_door_height}={closet_door_area}>>{closet_door_area} sq. ft.

The total area of the doors and windows is {doorway_area} sq. ft + {window_area} sq. ft. + {closet_door_area} sq. ft. = <<{doorway_area}+{window_area}+{closet_door_area}={total_obstacles_area}>>{total_obstacles_area} sq. ft.

The solid wall is {solid_wall_area} sq. ft., so before the areas of the doors and window are taken into account, the total wall area is {num_walls} * {solid_wall_area} sq. ft. = <<{num_walls}*{solid_wall_area}={total_gross_wall_area}>>{total_gross_wall_area} sq. ft.

Taking into account the doors and window, the total wall area Linda will have to paint is {total_gross_wall_area} sq. ft. - {total_obstacles_area} sq. ft. = <<{total_gross_wall_area}-{total_obstacles_area}={paintable_area}>>{paintable_area} sq. ft.
